p:
A paradigmatic study on the impact of climate change on future nitrate concentrations in groundwater of the UK by Stuart et al. ( 2011) summarizes potential changes on the hydrological processes that will affect nitrate concentration using a source–pathway–receptor framework. These authors concentrate on three main questions to understand the nature of climate change impact on groundwater nitrate concentrations:
i.
What are the likely changes to agricultural practices and how may these affect nitrate leaching from the soil zone?
ii.
What are the likely changes to groundwater recharge mechanisms and groundwater levels?
iii.
What are the likely changes to nitrate concentrations in groundwater and the consequent impact on groundwater receptors?
